page.title: 07An Upland Farm in Wolsingham
page.content: {Farming}in the Wolsingham area varies mainly according to the scale of operation.{Altitude}and{rainfall}make the land most suitable for{grazing sheep and cattle;some barley is grown and animal foodstuffs produced. {Thistlewood Farm}is typical of the smaller unit.On this 116 acre farm,George Gill grows kale and grass for his 30 cows and 25 calves.He is able to send about 350 litres of milk to the depot at Durham every day;he is one of the two main {milk delivery}men in Wolsingham. Much of the 116 acres is suitable only for grazing sheep.To cover this extensive upland area,a farm bike is used,usually accompanied by the three sheepdogs. George Gill rarely comes into Wolsingham,except when delivering milk.
